title: jerry0
author: jerry0
content: Still using ledger live 2.5.1.Ledger live is 2.55.Any issues with the updated one?  Haven't updated it in months.  Anyone here use old not updated ledger live?

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: jerry0 on April 22, 2023, 10:03:14 PMStill using ledger live 2.5.1.Ledger live is 2.55.Any issues with the updated one?  Haven't updated it in months.  Anyone here use old not updated ledger live?I'm not a LL user, but it's worth noting that the latest version is actually 2.57.0: LEDGER LIVE DOWNLOAD SIGNATURES- You always have the option to downgrade from the above link, so just update your LL to the latest one!To answer your question about 2.55.0:Is the Ledger Live 2.55.0 update safe and operational?Ledger Live 2.55.0 - The procedure entry point could not be lacated

comments.author: Husna QA
comments.created_time: April 23, 2023, 06:02:17 PMLast edit: May 16, 2023, 01:14:26 PM by Husna QA
comments.body: Quote from: jerry0 on April 22, 2023, 10:03:14 PMStill using ledger live 2.5.1.Ledger live is 2.55.Any issues with the updated one?  Haven't updated it in months.  Anyone here use old not updated ledger live?Previously, I used Ledger Live 2.55.0 and had no problems using it; I only installed the Bitcoin application. There is no new feature in the update. It just fixes minor bugs and performance improvements to the Ledger Live application.As mentioned by SFR10 above, Ledger Live 2.57.0 is now available.Some features are removed in this update.
